meta.notes: Mid-handicap right-handed golfer with right eye dominance, playing a 7-iron.

summary.headline: Solid fundamentals with room to improve consistency and power through better pivot and low point control.
bullets: Setup posture and alignment generally sound but can tighten for better control.
Backswing and downswing path need more on-plane sequence to reduce slices and thin shots.
Pivot timing is inconsistent leading to less power and variable ball contact.
Clubface control at impact fluctuates causing directional misses.
Priority on developing a repeatable low point and improving start line accuracy.

strengths: Good basic posture and balanced athletic stance at setup.
Consistent grip with proper hand positioning for a right-handed player.
Positive intent to improve fundamental pivot and contact.

priorityFixes.title: Improve Pivot and Weight Shift
priorityFixes.detail: Focus on initiating the downswing with the lower body and maintaining correct sequencing to generate more power and control.

priorityFixes.title: Control Low Point and Ball Contact
priorityFixes.detail: Develop feel for lowering the clubhead below the ball at impact to avoid thin or fat shots.

priorityFixes.title: Stabilize Clubface Through Impact
priorityFixes.detail: Work on maintaining square clubface alignment through the hitting zone to reduce directional misses.

powerLeaks: Early arm casting leading to loss of power and inconsistent strike.
Limited hip rotation reducing swing speed and leverage.
Swing path often outside-in causing slices and weak fades.
Lifted low point resulting in hitting behind the ball or topping it.
Grip pressure variation causing tension and poor timing.

checkpoints.label: Setup
checkpoints.note: Good balance and posture but alignment could be more precise.
errors: Feet aligned slightly open to target line causing fade tendencies.
Ball position sometimes too far back leading to fat contact.
Tension in hands and arms at address.
drills: Place alignment sticks parallel to target for visual feedback.
Practice setup in front of a mirror focusing on posture and relaxed grip.
Use pre-shot routine focusing on balanced stance.

checkpoints.label: Takeaway
checkpoints.note: Smooth takeaway with good one-piece movement starting from shoulders.
errors: Occasional wrapping of club inside on backswing.
drills: Slow-motion takeaway focusing on shoulder turn.
Use a headcover under right armpit to encourage connected movement.

checkpoints.label: Top of Backswing
checkpoints.note: Backswing length is acceptable but sometimes goes flat causing path issues.
errors: Club gets laid off behind the body.
Left heel sometimes lifts off the ground too early.
drills: Pause drill at top to check club position.
Wall drill to prevent excessive lateral movement.

checkpoints.label: Downswing Initiation
checkpoints.note: Starts downswing prematurely with arms causing casting and loss of power.
errors: Lack of clear lower body lead.
Arms pulling the club away from the body too early.
drills: Step drill to feel initiating downswing with hips.
Slow drills focusing on sequencing hip rotation before arm movement.

checkpoints.label: Swing Path
checkpoints.note: Club often comes over the top creating outside-in path.
drills: Swing path gate drill using alignment sticks to promote inside-out path.
Use impact tape to identify contact patterns.

checkpoints.label: Impact Position
checkpoints.note: Inconsistent low point leads to thin or fat strikes.
errors: Topping or striking too high on the face.
drills: Place a towel a few inches behind the ball to encourage forward low point.
Feet together drills to improve balance and timing.

checkpoints.label: Release
checkpoints.note: Clubface rotation sometimes too early causing pulls and blocks.
errors: Open or closed clubface at impact inconsistent.
drills: Slow drills emphasizing square clubface through impact.
Swing with pauses at impact to feel release timing.

checkpoints.label: Finish Position
checkpoints.note: Balanced finish with controlled weight on front foot and stable posture.
errors: Occasional loss of balance from swaying.
drills: Hold finish position for 3 seconds focusing on balance.
Practice slow swings to build control.

checkpoints.label: Mental Approach & Tempo
checkpoints.note: Inconsistent tempo leading to rushed swings under pressure.
drills: Count rhythm drill: 3 counts backswing, 3 counts downswing.
Establish a consistent pre-shot routine focusing on breathing.

practicePlan.overview: Over the next 14 days, focus on building a consistent and powerful pivot, improving low point control, and stabilizing clubface through impact. Work methodically through drills concentrating on sequencing, swing path, and tempo to build reliable ball striking.

days.label: DAYS 1–2: Setup & Takeaway Refinement
days.detail: Use alignment sticks and mirrors to lock in posture and target setup. Practice smooth, connected takeaways focusing on shoulder rotation.

days.label: DAYS 3–5: Pivot & Downswing Start
days.detail: Drill hip lead with step drills and slow-motion swings. Avoid early arm casting to retain power and swing width.

days.label: DAYS 6–8: Swing Path Adjustment
days.detail: Use swing path gate drills and impact tape feedback to reduce over-the-top moves and slices.

days.label: DAYS 9–11: Low Point & Contact Drills
days.detail: Use towel drills behind the ball and feet-together swings to improve strike and avoid fat shots.

days.label: DAYS 12–14: Clubface Control & Tempo
days.detail: Practice slow impact holds and counting tempo drills to build timing and reduce directional errors.
